tool.name: SATGradingEstimate

param.name: demInput
param.dialogReference: The raster dataset or mosaic dataset that represent the existing surface. Data that is lower resolution than the row-to-row spacing east-west will cause the tool to fail. Raster should be in a projected coordinate system, preferably State Plane or UTM. Vertical units for the raster much match the horizontal units of the projection.

param.name: rowsInput
param.dialogReference:
Feature class polygon that defines the rows. Rows must be individual features within the feature class and have a unique identifier field.

Feature class should be in the same coordinate system as the input elevation raster.

param.name: row_ID
param.dialogReference:
Field in the Tracker rows feature class that provides a unique value (string or integer) for each row.

This should have the same field name in both the tracker rows input and the piles input.

param.name: xyzUnit
param.dialogReference: Identifies the vertical and horizontal units of the Input elevation raster and horizontal units of the projection (Foot or Meter)

param.name: minReveal
param.dialogReference: The minimum reveal for the piles

param.name: maxReveal
param.dialogReference: The maximum reveal for the piles

param.name: gradeOut
param.dialogReference: The output raster dataset that is the graded surface calculated by the algorithm

param.name: pileOutput
param.dialogReference: A feature class point layer has existing surface, graded surface, reveal, top of pile elevation, cut and fill quantities, and plane of array north-south slope for each pile

param.name: gradeBoundsOut
param.dialogReference: A polygon feature class layer that defines the grading boundaries.

param.name: cutFillOption
param.dialogReference: An option that if checked will calculate cut and fill rasters for the graded surface versus the existing surface as well as a table with volume statistics

param.name: cutOut
param.dialogReference: A unique name for the output cut raster

param.name: fillOut
param.dialogReference: A unique name for the output fill raster

param.name: statsOutput
param.dialogReference: A standalone table that provides grading volume statistics for the analysis

param.name: lxmlOutputOption
param.dialogReference: An option that if checked will output the surface to a LandXML file.

param.name: lxmlOutput
param.dialogReference:
A unique name and path for the output LandXML file.

Must have “.xml” at the end of the file name

tool.summary: Creates a grading assessment for a defined solar tracker layout.
tool.usage:
• This tool outputs a graded surface for a solar tracker layout and a prescribed minimum and maximum reveal.

  • Outputs are a graded raster, grading boundaries, and a pile layer with details including existing elevation, graded elevation, reveal height, top of pile elevation, cut or fill at the pile, and plane of array north-south slope. Optional outputs include cut and fill rasters and grading volumes statistics, and the option to output a LandXML.
